newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - April 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - April 7.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The Catholic Church opposes moves to extend President Ramos' term saying it can provoke street demonstrations, endanger the economy and destabilise the nation. (PHILIPPINE STAR)

- The country will have to spend 3.0 billion pesos in interest payments every year because the Central Bank will unnecessarily borrow $1.25 billion from the international market, a group of economic reform activists warns. (TODAY)
- Several bombs exploded at an air force ammunitions depot in Basa Air Base in Pampanga on Saturday, injuring at least 15 people and damaging several houses, officials say. (MANILA TIMES)

- Asia Pacific finance ministers adopt a new set of initiatives to increase private sector participation in infrastructure projects, develop domestic financial markets and free up flows of capital in the region (BUSINESS DAILY)

- Socioeconomic planning secretary Cielito Habito says the government will still achieve its full-year inflation target of 6.0 to 6.5 percent despite a slight uptick in March inflation to 4.8 percent. (BUSINESSWORLD)
- Preliminary data released by the Central Bank shows that auto loan and credit card delinquencies are on the rise. (MANILA TIMES) - Manila newsroom (632) 841 8938
